# BMT65/75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide


# Introduction

###  Download and fill out the BMT65 Live Drive Inspection Report Checklist below before replacing any

parts.


[BMT65 LIVE DRIVE INSPECTION CHECKLIST](https://www.haascnc.com/content/dam/haascnc/service/guides/references/bmt65-inspection-checklist/ID0016_Rev_A.pdf)


[Refer to the manufacturers LIVE DUTY CYCLE by](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/haas-tooling/lathe_toolholding/live_toolholding.html)
selecting the Benz & Exsys Live Tool Duty
Cycles drop down tab.


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-1-0.png)

|Alarm 10.116 LT (Live Tool) Spindle Orientation Fault A tool change from a half station with an adjacent pocket that has a live tool to any other tool generates alarm 10.116 LT (Live Tool) Spindle Orientation Fault after updating software.|Software Issue. Lathes with the following specifications may have this issue: Machines with Old MOCON (Parameter 2100 = 0/FALSE) Press Diagnostic and navigate to the System tab. The MOCON version will be in the Software section. MOCON Version 1.16 or 1.16 .K is the Old MOCON Version. 24 Pocket BMT65 turret option. Software version 100.22.000.1020 to 100.22.000.2000.|Workaround #1: Machines with Old MOCON and 24 Pocket BMT65 turrets should not upgrade to software version 100.22.000.1020 to 100.22.000.2000. If the machine has been upgraded, downgrade to Software Version 100.22.000.1016. An Option 5 Software Update must be performed to downgrade software. Workaround #2: A patch can be applied to the machine that disables the half station pockets. Contact Haas Service to have the patch applied. Workaround #3: A new Software Version will be released that fixes this issue in a few weeks. All machines should upgrade to this software version once released. HSG-A 4-18-2023|
|---|---|---|
|Noise/Vibration|The drive is out of alignment.|Re-align the live tooling drive.|
||A drive bearing has failed.|Perform a Vibe Test.|
|The Live Tooling temperature exceeds 154°F (68°C).|The RPM is over 4500 and exceeds the duty cycle.|Refer to the manufacturers Live Duty Cycle by selecting the Benz & Exsys Live Tool Duty Cycles drop down tab.|


# Amplifier Short Circuit Inspection

Check the amplifier for a short. Power off the machine. Disconnect the cables for the axis servo motor at the
amplifier that generates the alarm.

Place MultiMeter Leads Here Instructions

Set the meter to ohms, and take the following readings:

Ground screw to RED, WHT, and BLK terminals

If the meter does not show open (o.l) the amplifier is
damaged.

Set the meter to Ohms, and take the following readings:

Black lead on HV (+) and Red lead to HV (-), RED, WHT,
and BLK terminals

If the meter does not show mega ohms or higher the
amplifier is damaged.

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/bmt-65-75--live-tooling-troubleshooting-guide.html 3/5

|Place MultiMeter Leads Here|Instructions|
|---|---|
||Set the meter to ohms, and take the following readings: Ground screw to RED, WHT, and BLK terminals If the meter does not show open (o.l) the amplifier is damaged.|
||Set the meter to Ohms, and take the following readings: Black lead on HV (+) and Red lead to HV (-), RED, WHT, and BLK terminals If the meter does not show mega ohms or higher the amplifier is damaged.|


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-2-0.png)

3:
|Col1|Set the meter to diode test mode, and take the following readings: Red lead on HV (-) and black lead to HV (+), RED, WHT, and BLK terminals If the meter does not show a voltage drop ranging from 0.2 to 0.8 volts the amplifier is damaged.|
|---|---|
||Set the meter to diode test mode, and take the following readings: Black lead on HV (-) and red lead to HV (+), RED, WHT, and BLK terminals If the meter does not show an open circuit (O.L) the amplifier is damaged.|


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

# Servo Motor Short Circuit Inspection

 Drive Alignment


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

Run the live tooling without a driven tool in
place. If the noise is gone or reduced check the
live tooling drive alignment.

[Follow the ALIGNMENT PROCEDURE fully.](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/how-to/bmt-65-75-turret-drive-alignment.html)


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/bmt-65-75--live-tooling-troubleshooting-guide.html 4/5

# Vibration Analyzer


[For a detailed procedure see BMT LIVE DRIVE](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/how-to/bmt-45-65-75-live-drive-turret-vibration-test.html)
[TURRET VIBRATION TEST](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/how-to/bmt-45-65-75-live-drive-turret-vibration-test.html)

Install an empty live tool holder in tool #1. Install
the accelerometer on the driven tool with the
unit centered over axis of rotation to see
maximum results.

Set the Averages to 8.

Right click on the plot and highlight X-Axis, click
on CPM.

Right click on the plot and highlight Y-Axis, click
on Vibration Displacement.

Right click on the plot and highlight Y-Axis,
Scaling, click on .1 mil.

Run the live tooling at 6000 RPM and start the
vibe test. NTE 0.01 MIL at 6000 CPM (RPM)

If the plot is out of tolorance, re-align the drive
and test again.

Use another driven tool to verify that it is not
causing the issue.

Verify alignment with the correct tooling before
any parts are replaced.

Possible parts that cause vibration are the
[bearing and LIVE DRIVE SHAFT or the servo](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/how-to/crashed-bmt-drive-replacement.html)
motor and coupler. Another cause could be a
coolant leak in the turret. Verify that no coolant
is found in the turret if replacing parts. Coolants
leaks happen if there is porosity in the turret.


![](photo/BMT65_75 - Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/BMT65_75---Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-4-0.png)

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/bmt-65-75--live-tooling-troubleshooting-guide.html 5/5
